ref: 1674 ujjháti ʻ leaves, escapes ʼ MBh. [Formed from pp. ujjhita -- < *ud -- źhita -- and replacing *ujjahāti, Pa. ujjahati: Mayrhofer EWA i 100 with lit.: √hā3]
Pa. ujjhati ʻ forsakes, sweeps or brushes away ʼ;
Pk. ujjhaï ʻ abandons ʼ, ujjhiya -- ʻ left, dried up ʼ;
G. ujhavvũ (< *ujjhā̆vēi) ʻ to give up, abandon, close, finish ʼ. <-> Connexion doubtful with
S. ujhiṛaṇu ʻ to be lost, wander idly ʼ,
L. ujjhaṛaṇ, ujjhiṛ˚ ʻ to be diminished, be completely divided ʼ.
